title: Earth Aligns Between Sun And Jupiter For Spectacular December 7 Event
content: On December 7, Earth will align between the Sun and Jupiter, creating a rare astronomical event known as Jupiters opposition.
summary: On December 7, Earth will align between the Sun and Jupiter, creating a rare astronomical event known as Jupiters opposition.

title: South Korea President Yoon Suk Yeol Clings To Power After Martial Law U-Turn
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was still clinging to power, with his party announcing they would oppose an opposition impeachment motion put forward after his stunning but brief imposition of martial law.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol was still clinging to power, with his party announcing they would oppose an opposition impeachment motion put forward after his stunning but brief imposition of martial law.

title: UK Band Sports Team Robbed At Gunpoint On US Tour
content: Footage captured from inside the Starbucks shows the suspect brandishing a firearm at the group's tour manager as she approached the van.
summary: Footage captured from inside the Starbucks shows the suspect brandishing a firearm at the group's tour manager as she approached the van.

title: After French Government Collapses, Lawmakers Call On "Macron To Go"
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday will seek ways out of France's political crisis, after Michel Barnier became the first prime minister to be ousted by parliament in over six decades.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Thursday will seek ways out of France's political crisis, after Michel Barnier became the first prime minister to be ousted by parliament in over six decades.

title: Harry Potter Sword Replicas Recalled In Japan For Being "Too Authentic"
content: Harry Potter sword replicas sold at a theme park in Japan have been recalled for being too authentic, potentially violating the anti-weapons law, Warner Bros. Studios Japan and media have said.
summary: Harry Potter sword replicas sold at a theme park in Japan have been recalled for being too authentic, potentially violating the anti-weapons law, Warner Bros. Studios Japan and media have said.

title: Cryptocurrency Bitcoin Hits New All-Time High Of $100,000
content: Bitcoin rose above $100,000 for the first time on Thursday as the election of Republican Donald Trump as president of the United States spurred expectations that his administration will create a friendly regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies.
summary: Bitcoin rose above $100,000 for the first time on Thursday as the election of Republican Donald Trump as president of the United States spurred expectations that his administration will create a friendly regulatory environment for cryptocurrencies.

title: All About Adam Boehler, Trump's Pick For US Hostage Affairs Envoy
content: US President-elect Donald Trump has named Adam Boehler as his administration's lead hostage negotiator at a time when the United States is seeking to secure the release of prisoners trapped in Gaza and other parts around the world.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump has named Adam Boehler as his administration's lead hostage negotiator at a time when the United States is seeking to secure the release of prisoners trapped in Gaza and other parts around the world.

title: NASA Offers $20,000 For Rescue Plan To Save Stranded Astronauts
content: The space agency offers up to $20,000 for the most effective design to safely transport a fully suited astronaut across the Moon's rugged terrain.
summary: The space agency offers up to $20,000 for the most effective design to safely transport a fully suited astronaut across the Moon's rugged terrain.

title: Granny's Purse Syndrome: Hidden Dangers For Children Parents Should Know
content: A pediatrician has raised alarms about "Granny's Purse Syndrome," a hidden danger during family holiday gatherings.
summary: A pediatrician has raised alarms about "Granny's Purse Syndrome," a hidden danger during family holiday gatherings.

title: United Healthcare CEO Received Death Threats Before Being Killed, Reveals Wife
content: The wife of the slain CEO of the largest US health insurance company has said that he had received death threats as police scrambled to find the man who brazenly shot him in mid-Manhattan.
summary: The wife of the slain CEO of the largest US health insurance company has said that he had received death threats as police scrambled to find the man who brazenly shot him in mid-Manhattan.

title: Scientists Examine Rare Spade-Tooth Whale: Key Discoveries Unveiled
content: Scientists in New Zealand are conducting the first-ever dissection of a complete spade-toothed whale, one of the rarest whale species globally.
summary: Scientists in New Zealand are conducting the first-ever dissection of a complete spade-toothed whale, one of the rarest whale species globally.

title: Donald Trump Picks Paul Atkins To Head US Securities Regulator
content: US President-elect Donald Trump nominated veteran Washington attorney Paul Atkins to chair the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), a move cheered by the cryptocurrency industry.
summary: US President-elect Donald Trump nominated veteran Washington attorney Paul Atkins to chair the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), a move cheered by the cryptocurrency industry.

title: South Korean Defence Minister Resigns Amid Row Over Martial Law
content: South Korean Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned Thursday, the president's office said, after the turmoil caused by President Yoon Suk Yeol's brief imposition of martial law.
summary: South Korean Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun resigned Thursday, the president's office said, after the turmoil caused by President Yoon Suk Yeol's brief imposition of martial law.

title: Amnesty International Says Israel Is "Committing Genocide" In Gaza
content: Amnesty International on Thursday accused Israel of "committing genocide" against Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the war last year, saying a new report was a "wake-up call" for the international community.
summary: Amnesty International on Thursday accused Israel of "committing genocide" against Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the war last year, saying a new report was a "wake-up call" for the international community.

title: North Korea, Russia Defence Treaty Comes Into Force
content: A landmark defence pact between North Korea and Russia, signed by its leaders in June, has gone into effect after the two sides exchanged ratification documents, North Korea's official KCNA news agency said Thursday.
summary: A landmark defence pact between North Korea and Russia, signed by its leaders in June, has gone into effect after the two sides exchanged ratification documents, North Korea's official KCNA news agency said Thursday.

title: Who Is South Korea's New Defence Minister After Botched Martial Law?
content: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has accepted the resignation of Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun and nominated the ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Choi Byung-hyuk, as new defence minister, the presidential office said on Thursday.
summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has accepted the resignation of Defence Minister Kim Yong-hyun and nominated the ambassador to Saudi Arabia, Choi Byung-hyuk, as new defence minister, the presidential office said on Thursday.

title: US Will "Speak Out" To Support South Korean Democracy: White House
content: The United States will "speak out" to South Korea to safeguard democracy after President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived imposition of martial law, National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said Wednesday.
summary: The United States will "speak out" to South Korea to safeguard democracy after President Yoon Suk Yeol's short-lived imposition of martial law, National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said Wednesday.

title: French Far-Left Calls For Macron's Resignation After No-Confidence Vote
content: France's hard left on Wednesday urged President Emmanuel Macron to resign and hold early presidential elections after lawmakers voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier.
summary: France's hard left on Wednesday urged President Emmanuel Macron to resign and hold early presidential elections after lawmakers voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier.

title: 700 Bangladeshi Terrorists, Death Row Convicts Still On Run After Jailbreak
content: Around 700 Bangladeshi prison inmates were still on the run after mass jailbreaks over the summer during the student-led revolution that ousted autocratic ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina, authorities said Wednesday.
summary: Around 700 Bangladeshi prison inmates were still on the run after mass jailbreaks over the summer during the student-led revolution that ousted autocratic ex-prime minister Sheikh Hasina, authorities said Wednesday.

title: French Government Collapses After PM Barnier Loses No-Confidence Vote
content: French lawmakers on Wednesday voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier after just three months in office in a move which deepens a political crisis in the country.
summary: French lawmakers on Wednesday voted to oust the government of Prime Minister Michel Barnier after just three months in office in a move which deepens a political crisis in the country.
